definitions.definition: Someone who is from the hills; especially from a rural area, with a connotation of a lack of refinement or sophistication.
A white person from the rural southern part of the United States, especially the Southeastern states.
To emphasize one's rural or humble upbringing; to use unsophisticated charm.
To portray or act as an uneducated and unsophisticated fool.
To perform or experience stereotypically hillbilly-like actions.
Of or relating to Caesarea.
Of, relating to or in the manner of Julius Caesar or other Caesars.
Given to shivering; tending to shiver.
definitions.example: The cold night made me all shivery.

definitions.definition: Easily broken; brittle.
Having great power of leaping or running; nimble; active.
Vigorous; lively; cheerful.
A slight wound.
A dash or stroke.
A niggard.
A poor-looking creature; a wretch.
To scratch or scrape.
A small, usually minor road used by a significant amount of traffic as a short cut or to avoid congestion on more major routes.
To drive through residential streets to avoid congestion on the main roads.
Triticum turgidum subsp. durum, syn. Triticum durum (hard wheat), the flour of which is used to make pasta and bread.
A false substitute for a person's hair; a toupee or wig.
A card much like a credit card, but which takes money directly from the bank account, rather than borrowing the money from the issuer of the card.
A member of a sect.
A bigot.
Of, or relating to a sect.
definitions.example: We were discussing solutions to the sectarian violence between Sunnis and Shias.

definitions.definition: Dogmatic or partisan.
Parochial or narrow-minded.
Bigoted.
(usually uncountable) A plant (Cyperus papyrus) in the sedge family, native to the Nile river valley.
(usually uncountable) A material similar to paper made from the papyrus plant.
A scroll or document written on papyrus.
A device on or adjacent to an outer door for announcing one's presence. It can be mechanical, directly sounding a bell, or a button that electrically sounds a chime or buzzer inside the building.
A button that actives an electric doorbell.
To ring many doorbells in an effort to contact people and thereby spread information or solicit.
To ring many doorbells of (target people or an area) in an effort to contact people and thereby spread information or solicit.
definitions.example: We doorbelled the whole district in an effort to get out the vote.

definitions.definition: Of a garment, having no sleeves.
Wanting a cover, pretext, or palliation; unreasonable; profitless; useless.
definitions.example: The vexation of a sleeveless errand. — Bishop Warburton.

definitions.definition: Any device in which a controlled chain reaction is maintained for the purpose of creating heat (for power generation) or for creating neutrons and other fission products for experimental, medical or other purposes.
A large tropical American snake, Boa constrictor, that kills its prey by squeezing them
A weapon intended to immobilize, usually through delivery of an electric shock.
One who plays the drums.
Travelling salesman
A drumstick (the lower part of a chicken or turkey leg).
Any of various fish of the family Kyphosidae which make a drumming sound.
Any psychological disorder characterized by abnormal eating habits
An expression used to show contentment for something
definitions.example: Mmm, this is a tasty pie!

definitions.definition: An expression used to show thought or reflection
definitions.example: Mmm, I see what you mean.

definitions.definition: An expression used to show being muffled or not able to speak clearly, as well as "mmph".
Yes.
A period into which a year is divided, historically based on the phases of the moon.
definitions.example: July is my favourite month.

definitions.definition: A period of 30 days, 31 days, or some alternation thereof.
definitions.example: We went on holiday for two months.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) A woman's period; menstrual discharge.
To do something.
definitions.example: If you don't act soon, you will be in trouble.

definitions.definition: To do (something); to perform.
To perform a theatrical role.
definitions.example: I started acting at the age of eleven in my local theatre.

definitions.definition: Of a play: to be acted out (well or badly).
To behave in a certain manner for an indefinite length of time.
definitions.example: A dog which acts aggressively is likely to bite.

definitions.definition: To convey an appearance of being.
definitions.example: He acted unconcerned so the others wouldn't worry.

definitions.definition: To do something that causes a change binding on the doer.
definitions.example: act on behalf of John

definitions.definition: (construed with on or upon) To have an effect (on).
definitions.example: Gravitational force acts on heavy bodies.

definitions.definition: To play (a role).
definitions.example: He's been acting Shakespearean leads since he was twelve.

definitions.definition: To feign.
definitions.example: He acted the angry parent, but was secretly amused.

definitions.definition: (construed with on or upon, of a group) To map via a homomorphism to a group of automorphisms (of).
definitions.example: This group acts on the circle, so it can't be left-orderable!

definitions.definition: To move to action; to actuate; to animate.
An action or deed.
Something done by a party — so called to avoid confusion with the legal senses of deed and action.
Pretending.
The occupation of an actor.
Temporarily assuming the duties or authority of another person when they are unable to do their job.
definitions.example: Acting President of the United States is a temporary office in the government of the United States.

definitions.definition: A soft, moist, shapeless mass or matter.
A magazine or book containing lurid subject matter and characteristically printed on rough, unfinished paper.
To make or be made into pulp.
To beat to a pulp.
To deprive of pulp; to separate the pulp from.
Of or pertaining to pulp magazines; in the style of a pulp magazine or the material printed within such a publication.
The smallest linguistic unit within a word that can carry a meaning.
A sauce, especially for pasta, originating from the Genoa region in Italy, made from basil, garlic, pine nuts, olive oil and cheese (usually pecorino)
The state of a society being without authorities or an authoritative governing body.
Anarchism; the political theory that a community is best organized by the voluntary cooperation of individuals, rather than by a government, which is regarded as being coercive by nature.
A chaotic and confusing absence of any form of political authority or government.
Confusion in general; disorder.
A set of sequential operations established in a factory whereby materials are put through a refining process or components are assembled to make a finished article.
A European bird, Corvus frugilegus, of the crow family.
A cheat or swindler; someone who betrays.
A type of firecracker used by farmers to scare birds of the same name.
A trick-taking game, usually played with a specialized deck of cards.
A bad deal, a rip-off.
To cheat or swindle.
A piece shaped like a castle tower, that can be moved only up, down, left or right (but not diagonally) or in castling.
A castle or other fortification.
A rookie.
Mist; fog; roke
To squat; to ruck.
Pronunciation spelling of look.
The simplest alkali metal, the lightest solid element, and the third lightest chemical element (symbol Li) with an atomic number of 3. It is a soft, silvery metal.
A single atom of this element.
Lithium carbonate or other preparations of lithium metal used to treat manic depression and bipolar disorders.
A lithium battery.
One who fails to fulfill an obligation or perform a task, especially a legal or financial one.
A diversion or deviation from one's original route.
To make a detour.
To direct or send on a detour.
A person who sculpts; an artist who produces sculpture.
One who attends horse races or dog races.
A pot filled with soil in which plants are grown.
A place where the bodies of dead people are cremated
One who slashes.
A machine for applying size to warp yarns.
A horror movie with graphic blood and violence. A slasher movie
One who self-injures by cutting.
A tool for cutting undergrowth.
One who writes slash fiction and/or supports male/male ships.
The state of being a parent
The property of being unpleasant or disagreeable.
An unpleasant behaviour, occurrence, etc.
To get away, or escape, taking (something) with one.
definitions.example: The thieves got away with a million pounds' worth of jewellery.

definitions.definition: To escape punishment for doing something or avoid doing some work.
definitions.example: Do you think we could get away with taking Dad’s car?

definitions.definition: Act of joining together into a single political entity.
definitions.example: It is 106 years since federation.

definitions.definition: Array of nations or states that are unified under one central authority which is elected by its members.
Any society or organisation formed from separate groups or bodies.
A collection of network or telecommunication providers that offer interoperability.
Of an architectural style popular around the time of federation.
definitions.example: We live in a federation house.

definitions.definition: The state of being criminal.
Criminal activity.
A criminal act.
The action of naturalizing somebody; act of granting citizenship.
The admission or adoption of foreign words or customs into general use.
The introduction and establishment of an animal or plant into a place where it is not indigenous.
The belief that the centralization of power in a state (sovereign polity) is the ideal or best way to organize humanity.
A coarse woolen fabric used for clothing.
The regurgitated former contents of a stomach; vomitus.
The act of regurgitating.
That which causes vomiting; an emetic.
To regurgitate or eject the contents of the stomach through the mouth; puke.
To regurgitate and discharge (something swallowed); to spew.
To eject from any hollow place; to belch forth; to emit.
A title of honour similar to "master" or "father", used of historical and legendary figures of the past.
A small truck or sledge used in coal mines.
A rank of black belt in martial arts
Someone who has achieved a level of black belt
A traditional South and East Asian unit of weight, based upon the load of a shoulder pole and varying by place and over time but usually standardized at about 60 kg.
Politics that is dominated by rivalry between political parties
A dock that can be drained of water and is used in the repair and construction of ships.
A mechanised weapon, based on the bow and arrow, that shoots bolts.
A portable ballista that can be held in the hand.
Someone who romps or frolics.
A ship that has moved far ahead of a convoy; see also straggler.
A onesie.
A one-piece garment for babies and small children, consisting of a top and trousers. A romper suit.
definitions.example: He is wearing the last clean rompers I had for him and they are getting dirtier by the minute.

definitions.definition: To use a needle to pass thread repeatedly through (pieces of fabric) in order to join them together.
definitions.example: Balls were first made of grass or leaves held together by strings, and later of pieces of animal skin sewn together and stuffed with feathers or hay.

definitions.definition: To use a needle to pass thread repeatedly through pieces of fabric in order to join them together.
Followed by into: to enclose by sewing.
definitions.example: to sew money into a bag

definitions.definition: To drain the water from.
Of a ship, to be grounded.

A radio or television serial, typically broadcast in the afternoon or evening, about the lives of melodramatic characters, which are often filled with strong emotions, highly dramatic situations and suspense.
A very long spear used two-handed by infantry soldiers for thrusting (not throwing), both for attacks on enemy foot soldiers and as a countermeasure against cavalry assaults.
A sharp point, such as that of the weapon.
A large haycock.
Any carnivorous freshwater fish of the genus Esox, especially the northern pike, Esox lucius.
A position with the knees straight and a tight bend at the hips with the torso folded over the legs, usually part of a jack-knife.
A pointy extrusion at the toe of a shoe.
Especially in place names: a hill or mountain, particularly one with a sharp peak or summit.
definitions.example: Scafell Pike is the highest mountain in England.

definitions.definition: A pick, a pickaxe.
A hayfork.
A penis.
To prod, attack, or injure someone with a pike.
To assume a pike position.
To bet or gamble with only small amounts of money.
Often followed by on or out: to quit or back out of a promise.
definitions.example: Don’t pike on me like you did last time!

definitions.definition: Short for turnpike.
definitions.example: There is heavy traffic on the Mass Pike

definitions.definition: A gypsy, itinerant tramp, or traveller from any ethnic background; a pikey.
To equip with a turnpike.
(thieves' cant) To depart or travel (as if by a turnpike), especially to flee, to run away.
A showing of a movie, sporting event, or theatrical performance in the morning or afternoon.
A woman's dress to be worn in the morning or before dinner.
To put on a matinee performance (of).
Resembling a devil.
Characteristic of a devil.
definitions.example: a devilish grin

definitions.definition: Extreme, excessive.
definitions.example: A devilish effort yielded a devilish success.

definitions.definition: Devilishly; very; exceedingly.
definitions.example: It was devilish hot outside today.

definitions.definition: An alkaloid, found in some species of Ephedra shrubs (or prepared synthetically).
A medication whose active ingredient is ephedrine, used as a sympathomimetic drug.
A hybrid sport involving the traversal of a coastline without mechanical aids, usually by some mixture of jumping, walking, climbing and swimming.
A cheese styled after the Cheddar cheese made in Cheddar.
Money, cash, currency.
(cheese making) To cut and press cheese so as to remove the whey and leave drier curds.
A snake.
An obsolete wind instrument in the brass family, whose shape is suggestive of a snake (Wikipedia article).
A subtle, treacherous, malicious person.
A kind of firework with a serpentine motion.
To wind or meander
To encircle.
The part of a country which borders or faces another country or unsettled region
The most advanced or recent version of something; leading edge.
definitions.example: the frontier of civilization

definitions.definition: An outwork of a fortification.
To live as pioneers on frontier territory.
To place on the frontier.
A substance with medicinal properties intended to restore or invigorate.
definitions.example: We used to brew a tonic from a particular kind of root.

definitions.definition: Tonic water.
(Massachusetts) Any of various carbonated, non-alcoholic beverages; soda pop.
Someone or something that revitalises or reinvigorates.
Pertaining to tension, especially of muscles.
Restorative, curative or invigorating.
definitions.example: The arrival of the new members had a tonic effect on the team.

definitions.definition: The first note of a diatonic scale; the keynote.
The triad built on the tonic note.
A tonic element or letter; a vowel or a diphthong.
Pertaining to or based upon the first note of a diatonic scale.
Pertaining to the accent or stress in a word or in speech.
Of or relating to tones or sounds; specifically being or relating to a speech sound made with tone unmixed and undimmed by obstruction, i.e. a vowel or diphthong.
To give up; yield to another.
definitions.example: Edward decided to cede the province.

definitions.definition: To give way.
The residence of Roman Catholic priest(s) associated with a parish church.
The residence of an Anglican rector.
To make (something) lower (especially of clothes).
To demolish or destroy (a building etc.).
To cause to fall to the floor
Heavy, massive, weighty.
(by extension) Serious, onerous, oppressive.
Clumsy, unwieldy, or slow, especially due to weight.
Dull, boring, tedious; long-winded in expression.
Characterized by or associated with pondering.
Dense.
A picture.
Fussy; particular; demanding to have things just right.
definitions.example: I am very picky about the way my kitchen is laid out.

definitions.definition: A brilliant, dark blue-green colour, like the plumage of a peacock.
Of a brilliant blue-green colour.
A helpline provided by a manufacturer of a product
Alternative letter-case form of Yule
To occur, take place.
To be emitted or breathed out; to evaporate.
To expose to the air, ventilate.
An equestrian event which comprises dressage, cross-country, and showjumping.
The ability of one system or part of a program to send notifications to another, by raising events.
The occurrence of an event.
Another name for a high school (e.g. some high schools are called collegiates rather than high schools)
A member of a college, a collegian; someone who has received a college education.
A fellow-collegian; a colleague.
An inmate of a prison.
Of, or relating to a college, or college students.
Collegial.
An agent that prevents or counteracts depression.
(pharmaceutical effect) Preventing or counteracting depression.
The person who does the prompting.
A single droplet of rainwater that has just fallen or is falling from the sky.
To render handsome.
(of people, things, etc) Having a good appearance; good-looking.
definitions.example: a handsome garment, house, tree, or horse

definitions.definition: Good, appealing, appropriate.
Generous or noble in character.
definitions.example: Handsome is as handsome does.

definitions.definition: Ample; moderately large.
definitions.example: a handsome salary

definitions.definition: (said of things and people) Dexterous; skillful.
Clothes worn at nighttime
Corn; a type of grain of the species Zea mays.
Any convex body or surface.
Curved or bowed outward like the outside of a bowl or sphere or circle
(of a set in Euclidean space) arranged such that for any two points in the set, a straight line between the two points is contained within the set.
(of a polygon) having no internal angles greater than 180 degrees.
(of a real-valued function on the reals) having an epigraph which is a convex set.
A portion; a component.
Duty; responsibility.
definitions.example: to do one’s part

definitions.definition: The dividing line formed by combing the hair in different directions.
definitions.example: The part of his hair was slightly to the left.

definitions.definition: In the Hebrew lunisolar calendar, a unit of time equivalent to 3⅓ seconds.
A constituent of character or capacity; quality; faculty; talent; usually in the plural with a collective sense.
A person or animal who receives treatment from a doctor or other medically educated person.
(grammar) The noun or noun phrase that is semantically on the receiving end of a verb's action.
definitions.example: The subject of a passive verb is usually a patient.

definitions.definition: One who, or that which, is passively affected; a passive recipient.
Cardiovascular and strength training and its related minimum standards and scores used to determine standing for positions
A discrete division of something.
A sharp extremity.
One of the several different parts of the escutcheon.
A short piece of cordage used in reefing sails.
A string or lace used to tie together certain garments.
Lace worked by the needle.
definitions.example: point de Venise; Brussels point

definitions.definition: An item of private information; a hint; a tip; a pointer.
The attitude assumed by a pointer dog when he finds game.
definitions.example: The dog came to a point.

definitions.definition: The perpendicular rising of a hawk over the place where its prey has gone into cover.
The act of pointing, as of the foot downward in certain dance positions.
The gesture of extending the index finger in a direction in order to indicate something.
A vaccine point.
In various sports, a position of a certain player, or, by extension, the player occupying that position.
A hard substance made of the limestone skeletons of marine polyps.
A colony of marine polyps.
A somewhat yellowish pink colour, the colour of red coral.
The ovaries of a cooked lobster; so called from their colour.
A piece of coral, usually fitted with small bells and other appurtenances, used by children as a plaything.
Made of coral.
Having the yellowish pink colour of coral.
A person who studies or practises genealogy, an expert in genealogy.
An examination formerly administered to all students in their final year of primary education, now used only in a few counties of England and Northern Ireland.
One who suffers.
One who is afflicted.
